fixes.name: Discount Amount
fixes.dax_expression: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales] * 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount]
fixes.solution_explanation: Direct translation of row-level arithmetic [Sales]*[Discount] to DAX. Created as a calculated column because it uses only same-row fields.

fixes.name: Discount Health
fixes.dax_expression: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Amount] / 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales]
fixes.solution_explanation: Direct translation of row-level division [Discount Amount]/[Sales] to DAX. Created as a calculated column because it uses only same-row fields.

fixes.name: Loss Flag
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit] < 0, 1, 0)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF to DAX IF for a row-level comparison ([Profit]<0). Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Profit Margin %
fixes.dax_expression: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] * 100
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level arithmetic [Profit Ratio ]*100 to DAX. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Revenue Stability
fixes.dax_expression: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] + 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ]
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level addition [Net Revenue ]+[Profit Ratio ] to DAX. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Profit vs Target (Uses Profit Margin %)
fixes.dax_expression: 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] - 15
fixes.solution_explanation: Direct translation of row-level arithmetic [Profit Margin %]-15 to DAX. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Profitablity Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 20,
    "High Margin",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10,
        "Medium Margin",
        "Low Margin"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF / ELSEIF chain to nested DAX IF for row-level thresholds on [Profit Margin %]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Revenue Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Net Revenue ] > 1000,
    "High Margin",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Margin %] > 10,
        "Medium Margin",
        "Low Margin"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF using row-level fields [Net Revenue ] and [Profit Margin %]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Profit Health
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Ratio ] > 0.2,
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "High",
        "Excellent",
        "Good"
    ),
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Tier] = "Low",
        "Poor",
        "Average"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated nested Tableau IF/ELSEIF logic to nested DAX IF. Uses row-level fields [Profit Ratio ] and [Revenue Tier]; created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25,
    "High Discount",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10,
        "Medium Discount",
        "Low Discont"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF for row-level thresholds on [Discount Health]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Performance Code
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Is High Performing ] = "Yes",
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] + 2,
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Quality Score ] - 1
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated row-level IF to DAX IF using [Is High Performing ] and [Quality Score ]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Final Score
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "Low Discont",
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code] + 1,
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Performance Code]
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF to DAX IF for row-level logic combining [Discount Tier] and [Performance Code]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Failure Risk
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Loss Flag] = 1 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "High Discount ",
    "High Risk",
    "Low Risk"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF with AND to DAX IF using && for logical AND. Uses row-level fields; created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Order Health Score
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Failure Risk] = "High Risk",
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score] - 2,
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Final Score]
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF to DAX IF for row-level logic on [Failure Risk] and [Final Score]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Priority Segment
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit Health] = "Excellent" && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profitablity Tier] = "High Margin",
    "Top Priority",
    "Normal"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF with AND to DAX IF using &&. Uses row-level fields [Profit Health] and [Profitablity Tier]; created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Overall Rating
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Priority Segment] = "Top Priority",
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Health Score] + 1,
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Order Health Score]
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted row-level IF to DAX IF for [Priority Segment] and [Order Health Score]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Stability Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Stability] > 200,
    "Stable",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Revenue Stability] > 50,
        "Moderate",
        "Unstable"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF using row-level [Revenue Stability]. Created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Overall Health
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Overall Rating] > 5 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Stability Tier] = "Stable",
    "Excellent",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Overall Rating] > 3,
        "Good",
        "Poor"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF and used && for logical AND. Uses row-level fields [Overall Rating] and [Stability Tier]; created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Target Status
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit vs Target (Uses Profit Margin %)] > 0,
    "Above Target ",
    "Below Target"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated Tableau IF to DAX IF for row-level comparison on [Profit vs Target (Uses Profit Margin %)]. Created as a calculated column. (Kept the original string literal including trailing space exactly as in the Tableau expression.)

fixes.name: Success Flag
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Target Status] = "Above Target" && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Overall Health] = "Excellent",
    "Success",
    "Try Again"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF with AND to DAX IF using &&. This is a row-level classification depending only on calculated fields and raw columns, so it is implemented as a calculated column.
